stories.text:
You can remove lots of noise on YouTube using these:

- SponsorBlock

- uBlockOrigin

- No YouTube Comments

- Disable YouTube Cards

- Remove YouTube Suggestions

- BlockTube

BlockTube lets you block individual channels via channel IDs. You need to add each of these IDs manually. You can also import a list of IDs. I am looking for a list of IDs targeting primarily influencers and clickbait channels. (I would also like to block anything related with politics, news, drama, ...)

Titles akin to "You Won't Believe This", "Almost Died", "This Will Shock You", "I Ate Nothing for A Day And This Is What Happened", "Don't Learn C++ in 2021", "Learn C++ in 2021", "I Bought 2 Million Pokémon Cards And This Is What Happened", "CNN Breaking News: Somebody Smirked", "Fox News: Cancel Culture Strikes Again", ... are quite annoying. Such unsolicited titles still sometimes occur in my search results. I would like to eliminate them completely.

I am unsure whether BlockTube lets you regex for typical clickbait titles.

Furthermore, I am thankful for any suggestions/strategies to mitigate noise on YouTube as much as possible.

Thank you in advance, HN!
stories.title: Ask HN: Looking for a YouTube Clickbait/Influencer Blocklist (BlockTube)
